title: Direction
text: We can tell whether the parabola goes left or right based on the sign of a in the equation, $$x=a y^2+b y+c$$. If a is negative, then the parabola goes left, if it is positive, it goes right.

title: Direction
text: Since our a is positive, what does this tell us about our parabola?

title: Right Direction
text: Since our a is postitive, we know that our parabola will open up towards the right.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: To find the vertex, we need to find the axis is symmetry, which is found using the formula, $$y=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: To find the axis of symmetry, we have to find the $$b$$ and a from our equation.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: Our $$b$$ and a are $$0$$ and $$3$$ respectively. Our axis of symmetry is $$y=3\frac{0}{2}$$.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Now that we have our axis of symmetry, we want to plug it back into the original equation to find the $$x$$ value of our vertex.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Since our $$y$$ is $$0$$, we plug it into our equation as, $$x=3\times0^2$$. This gives us $$x=0$$.

title: Vertex
text: Since we know that our $$y$$ is $$0$$ and our $$x$$ is $$0$$, our vertex is at the coordinates, $$(0,0)$$.

title: Intercepts
text: Since the vertex is $$(0,0)$$, the intercepts are also both $$(0,0)$$, so we need to plot points to graph it.

title: Graphing
text: Note that points are symmetric to each other across the x-axis.
